info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 11 at 8:13AM MST until October 11 at 10:15AM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...West Clear Creek. Portions of north central and west central Arizona, including the following counties, in north central Arizona, Coconino. In west central Arizona, Yavapai.
* WHEN...Until 1015 AM MST.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks and normally dry washes is occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 811 AM MST, a stream gage on West Clear Creek indicated 5.5 feet of water in West Clear Creek that will continue to move downstream towards Camp Verde. Stream levels are just beginning to decrease, but flooding is expected for the next 2 hours. Flooding is ongoing. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... West Clear Creek, Verde River, Clover Creek and Long Canyon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Camp Verde, Indian Maiden Falls, Hanging Garden, Bullpen Day Use Area, Verde Lakes, Rockin' River Ranch State Park and West Clear Creek Wilderness. - This includes State Route 260 between mile markers 225 and 231.
This includes the following recreation areas and campgrounds... Clear Creek Group Campgrounds.
This includes the following swimming holes... Bull Pen Day Use Area, West Clear Creek near the campground and Indian Maiden Falls. - Additional information is available at weather.gov/flagstaff.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Low water crossings will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
Report flooding to local law enforcement or NWS Flagstaff on our Facebook or Twitter pages when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM MST THIS MORNING
